1.title: Kultured Misfits
1.subtitle: Kultured Misfits is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Atlanta, Georgia. With a heavy influence from culture found in music, film, and art, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own to impact our everyday life.

products.name: Kultured Misfits Tracksuit (Crew + Joggers)
products.description: Classic Kultured Misfits tracksuIt set with matching crewneck and jogger pants in black. A comfortable cotton mix jogger, featuring embroidered Kultured Misfits logo on the left chest and thigh. Drawstring waist and cuffed hems.

products.name: Legalize Free College (Do Tha Right Thang) T-Shirt
products.description: Every sale of a Legalize Free College product will contribute to the "Legalize Free College Scholarship"!

products.name: MISFIT Embossed Crewneck
products.description: Premium crewneck is cut from French terry jersey. With the embossed cursive logo adds a signature finishing touch to its classic design.

1.title: So you want to talk about race
1.subtitle: Ijeoma Oluo guides readers of all races through subjects ranging from intersectionality and affirmative action to "model minorities" in an attempt to make the seemingly impossible possible: honest conversations about race and racism, and how they infect almost every aspect of American life.

2.title: The Hate U Give
2.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

2.title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
2.subtitle: Baratunde Thurston explores the phenomenon of white Americans calling the police on black Americans who have committed the crimes of ... eating, walking or generally "living while black." In this profound, thought-provoking and often hilarious talk, he reveals the power of language to change stories of trauma into stories of healing — while challenging us all to level up.

3.title: MoreFire! Hot Sauce
3.subtitle: MoreFire! Hot Sauce is a concoction of spicy fiery goodness. For those who are serious about good quality food. We are 1st place nationwide award winning... so get on the winning Team. You need MoreFire! in your life!

products.name: MoreFire! Hot Sauce (Original)
products.description: 5 oz bottle of the multi-award winning Goldson’s MoreFire! Hot Sauce… Ay Yo! I GOT THAT FIRE!

products.name: MoreFire! Pepper Sauce (Louisiana Style)
products.description: 5 oz bottle of the 1st place Award Winning MoreFire! Pepper Sauce… Ay Yo! I GOT THAT FIRE!

products.name: I Got That Fire! T-Shirt – Box block
products.description: I Got That Fire! T-Shirt – Box block

3.title: Can the Beauty Industry Confront Colorism?
3.subtitle: The beauty industry has been trying to productively confront racism. Can it do the same with colorism, where lighter-skinned models are favored over those with darker skin?

4.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
4.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

4.title: Aloha Glamour
4.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

5.title: What Happened on May 25th?
5.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

5.title: Mass Incarceration: Visualized
5.subtitle: Concrete actions, more than stated beliefs, are a true reflection of values, both personal and societal. We may claim to value human life, but our societal actions and policies say otherwise.

6.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
6.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

6.title: Inn8 Apparel
6.subtitle: Your mind. Your body. Your individuality. Your imperfections. These are the things you are born with. They are innate. Embrace them. They are yours. Celebrate them. They are yours. Love them. They are you.

products.name: "Beholder" Embroidered Unisex Hoodie
products.description: Embroidered hoodies are custom made to order and will take approximately 2-3 weeks to receive apparel.  Crafted for comfort, this lighter weight sweatshirt is perfect for relaxing. Once put on, it will be impossible to take off.

products.name: "Human" Unisex T-Shirt
products.description: This heavy cotton tee has the classic cotton look and feel. Casual elegance will make it an instant favorite in everyone's wardrobe.

products.name: "A Soul Lost in Time" Premium Matte Vertcial Posters
products.description: Every room deserves to be special. These supreme quality print posters in various sizes serve as statement pieces, creating a personalized environment.

7.title: Ruth Nathan's
7.subtitle: It is Nicole R. Brown's desire that Ruth Nathan’s does not only make customers look spectacular but feel spectacular as well, positively influencing them to feel better about themselves. It is a known fact that when one dresses well, one feels better—and from an outfit that is well put together, that makes one walk with pride, the Urban Peacock emerges.

products.name: Blue Curved Mask
products.description: Still want to look dapper while protecting yourself and others? We have the answer! Reusable and re-washable, these fabric masks will keep you looking good and doing good. When you buy a curved face mask from Ruth Nathan’s we donate a rectangular face mask to health care professionals and essential workers in need.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
products.description: The deep older brother of the Franc Un pattern, the Franc Bleu’s watercolor pen lines convey elegance and a truly historic sense of style. Also inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Bleu carries notes of art deco, dancing under the stars, and midnight.

products.name: Franc Un Pocket Square
products.description: Inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Un pattern gives off a refined yet playful vibe sure to elevate your look during formal occasions. Perfect for when you want to be taken seriously—but not too seriously. Notes of Art Deco, French Quarter jazz, and pistachios.

7.title: Bamenda Coffee
7.subtitle: Want to have the best coffee beans in Chicago, Illinois? Get them here at Bamenda Coffee, where our coffee comes fresh from the highlands of Bamenda, Africa, and Latin America. We bring you 100% Arabica and Robusta coffee that will surely make you ask for more.

products.name: Green Coffee Beans, 100% Arabica
products.description: During the Process, the fruit part is stripped away and the seed inside is dried to leave raw green coffee beans. The roasted beans are ground and brewed to make our favorite drink.

products.name: The Chicago Dark
products.description: During the Process, the fruit part is stripped away and the seed inside is dried to leave raw green coffee beans. The roasted beans are ground and brewed to make our favorite drink.

products.name: Leshey Towels, "Kitchen Bar Mop" Cleaning towels
products.description: Leshey Towels, "Kitchen Bar Mop" cleaning towels, (12 Pack, 16 x 19) Amazing quality. Pure cotton white towels, restaurant cleaning towels, "shop towels" and rags - Bulk "Bar mops towels" set.

8.title: Kintu New York
8.subtitle: Kintu handbags are designed in New York, co-developed with global artisans, and made in Italy. The Kintu brand appeals to the dynamic, busy, urban woman who values quality and self-expression.

8.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
8.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

9.title: Build for Black Lives
9.subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

9.title: Aisha Likes It
9.subtitle:
It began with a problem. I kept looking for the kind of refined, eclectic, Afrobohemian jewelry I really wanted to wear to no avail. Certainly, there was Africa-inspired jewelry available, but much of it lacked the bohemian design aesthetic that fit my taste and style as an African American literature professor. I wanted pieces that could say a lot without doing a lot. My jewelry needed to standout and be distinctive while remaining wearable. I wanted a jewelry wardrobe that reflected my tastes, my passions, my culture, my research interests. And so I began to make my own, sourcing authentic, African diasporic materials, curating and refining my work as my knowledge and skill developed. Eventually, I decided to share my work and Aisha Likes It came into existence.

Aisha Likes it is home to African-inspired jewelry curated towards a bohemian aesthetic created with both ethically sourced materials from throughout the African diaspora and traditional semi-precious stones. Each piece is designed to make a statement at a fair price.

10.title: Esusu
10.subtitle: Forbes Under 30 social entrepreneurs, Nigerian-born entrepreneur Wemimo and his business partner Goel co-founded Esusu in 2019. The mobile platform helps individuals mostly from marginalized communities save money, access capital and build credit.

10.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
10.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

11.title: #JusticeforBre: Police officers who killed Breonna Taylor must be FIRED.
11.subtitle: Call for the three police officers responsible for the death of Breonna Taylor to be fired and charged for murder.

11.title: American Civil Liberties Union
11.subtitle: Donate to the ACLU. The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for over 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.

12.title: Dynamic Confluence
12.subtitle: I have items that I carry with me anywhere I go in case of an emergency. I couldn't find an emergency kit that was complete, so I made a few of my own. I hope people will find these items useful. It's better to have and not need, than need and not have.

12.title: Bedroom Kandi
12.subtitle: Welcome to Bedroom Kandi, where women, men, and their partners can pamper themselves with intimate luxury! At Bedroom Kandi, our mission is to destigmatize intimacy and self-love, promote sexual wellness and education, and empower entrepreneurs to find success and happiness in the business of pleasure.

13.title: What I am learning from my white grandchildren
13.subtitle: Are we in a post-racial society? Do we want to be? Anthony Peterson, an African American, draws from current research and from conversations with his Anglo American grandchildren to address truths about race in 21st century America.

13.title: Fewer Cards
13.subtitle: Fewer Cards is a touchless smart card that allows you to express yourself and share who you are with others by exchanging contact information, social media, and data seamlessly. The concept of Fewer Cards started from the fact that exchanging paper business cards is wasteful and cumbersome.

14.title: BLK & Proud Forever
14.subtitle: BLK & Proud Forever was started in 2019 for a family that was in need of some custom apparel that could display their Black pride. Our goal is to provide some great BLK&Proud gear that supports, celebrates and amplifies the dopeness in being Blackity Black Black 365.

14.title: What it takes to be racially literate
14.subtitle: Over the last year, Priya Vulchi and Winona Guo traveled to all 50 US states, collecting personal stories about race and intersectionality. Now they're on a mission to equip every American with the tools to understand, navigate and improve a world structured by racial division.

15.title: White Fragility: Why It's So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism
15.subtitle: This book explicates the dynamics of White Fragility and how we might build our capacity in the on-going work towards racial justice.

16.title: The Uses of Anger: Women Responding to Racism
16.subtitle: In June 1981, Audre Lorde gave the keynote presentation at the National Women’s Studies Association Conference, Storrs, Connecticut. Her presentation appears here.

16.title: YTPshop - African Clothing
16.subtitle: All YTPshop products are crafted by women in Nigeria and the fabrics are carefully sourced from West African markets. YTPshop products are made with high-quality material, cutting edge tailoring, vibrant colors, and are affordably priced.

17.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
17.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

17.title: An interview with the founders of Black Lives Matter
17.subtitle: In this spirited conversation with Mia Birdsong, the movement's three founders share what they've learned about leadership and what provides them with hope and inspiration in the face of painful realities. Their advice on how to participate in ensuring freedom for everybody: join something, start something and "sharpen each other, so that we all can rise."

18.title: Eb + Flo Boutique
18.subtitle: Eb and Flo started out as just a vision and manifested in 2020. Our CEO, Ebony Hunter, is a strong believer in living out your dreams while not only looking good but feeling good too. Our mission is to provide styles that flow with you from moment to moment, whether you’re making a quick run to the grocery store or meeting the girls for brunch. With comfort and quality in mind, we make looking lavish easy. Look good, feel good.

products.name: Classic Boss Lady Track Suit
products.description: Chic track suit for the lady on the go. Throw it on for a quick trip to the grocery store, a nail appointment, or dress it up for a cute brunch look.

products.name: Tedy Soft Sherpa Jacket
products.description: The warmest and most comfortable jacket you'll ever own! The Teddy Sherpa Jacket feels like a warm hug or like you're wearing a blanket. Features a drawstring hem that allows you to snatch that waist hunny *snap*snap*

products.name: "Thou shall not try me" T-Shirt
products.description: Mood 24:7! Let the folks know the deal in this super soft tee.

18.title: Open a random campaign to donate to
18.subtitle: Take the effort of decision out of it — tap here and we'll select a random campaign for you to support!

19.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
19.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

19.title: Corner 103
19.subtitle: Corner 103 has a reputation for making world class wines, and is committed to exceeding expectations.

products.name: NV Sparkling Rosé
products.description: This Gold Medal winning wine was made in the classic French style using traditional grapes; making it non-vintage; and using the methode champenoise process which requires a secondary fermentation in the bottle.

products.name: 2018 Chardonnay, Sonoma Carneros
products.description: Our 2018 Chardonnay was crafted from a low-yielding vineyard in the Carneros AVA that consistently produces some of the region's best Chardonnay grapes.

products.name: 2017 Grenache, Alexander Valley
products.description: Our 2017 Grenache is a balanced wine crafted from an amazing low yielding vineyard in the Alexander Valley that consistently delivers excellent fruit flavors and silky tannins.

20.title: Alaffia
20.subtitle:
Alaffia is an online Fair Trading company that specializes in soaps and beauty products. We aim to alleviate poverty and advance gender equality through the Fair Trade of indegenious resources and community empowerment projects.

Together, we’re cultivating beauty, equality and empowerment in West Africa and around the globe. Our women’s cooperatives in West Africa handcraft indigenous raw ingredients then the Alaffia team in Olympia, Washington creates the finished products. Alaffia returns the proceeds from the sale of these products to our communities to fund community empowerment and gender equality projects.

20.title: MLK: The Other America
20.subtitle: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.’s 1967 speech at Stanford. Here, he expounds on his nonviolent philosophy and methodology.

21.title: Book: The Global Beauty Industry
21.subtitle: Colorism, Racism, and the National Body

21.title: "ABC I Love Me"
21.subtitle: ABC I Love Me takes Black children along for a journey of self love, confidence, and adventure while teaching young learners positive affirmations for each letter of the alphabet. This book encourages children to accept their unique qualities, and promotes positive self-esteem and a healthy lifestyle.

22.title: Soul Cap
22.subtitle: Haircare for the volume-blessed. Being blessed with voluminous hair shouldn’t come with the curse of harsh chemicals or mediocre products.

22.title: Code Switch Podcast
22.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

23.title: NinetyNine Products
23.subtitle: Our mission is to deliver functional & beautiful product that celebrate the people who help people. 99% of our marketing dollars will spotlight those individuals we believe do more than their fare share of shaping our communities in positive ways.

23.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
23.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

24.title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
24.subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

24.title: VZN Clothing
24.subtitle: Our clothing is made to motivate you to visualize your goals and remain persistent through adversity. Vision is not simply seeing with the eyes, but rather creating a positive image and experience for your future success with your mind. By following your vision with action and remaining persistent through adversity, we believe anything is possible.

products.description: Black mask with red and white embroidery

products.description: For the Tre Series, we follow the boy, Tre, on his path of following his dreams. The purpose of Tre being lifted by the balloons while holding the basketball is to inspire people to work towards their goals with the confidence of a child who is following their dreams.

26.title: Walking While Black
26.subtitle: Garnette Cadogan on the Realities of Being Black in America

26.title: A.O. Hamer
26.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

27.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
27.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

27.title: Black Lives Matter
27.subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

28.title: Toni Morrison - Biography
28.subtitle: Toni Morrison was a Nobel and Pulitzer Prize-winning American novelist. Among her best-known novels are "The Bluest Eye," "Song of Solomon," "Beloved," and "A Mercy."

28.title: How to be an Antiracist
28.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

29.title: Loza Tam
29.subtitle: Shop our collection of women's African Head Wraps. All of our head wraps & turbans are lined in satin to protect the hair against frizz, breakage and moisture loss.

products.name: Black Satin Head Wrap

29.title: John Hope - Biography
29.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

30.title: Southern Elegance Candle Co.
30.subtitle: At Southern Elegance Candle Co., to be southern isn’t solely about where you’re from. Our collections are sure to please and will whisk you away to a special place of joy, love, and tranquility.

products.name: Tumbler Candle

products.name: Large 16oz Mason Jar Candle

products.name: Signature Year Round Scents Diffuser with Reeds
products.description: A Reed Diffuser is a great solution for offices, small rooms, or any place when a flame isn't desired. Each Reed Diffuser is a 6-ounce square glass bottle with a replaceable seal. Each bottle comes with its own set of 8 reeds.

30.title: Justice For Tony McDade
30.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

31.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
31.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

31.title: Black on Black
31.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.
